If you have shared objects with shared behavior, consider putting them in their own class and packaging the class as a module that all dependents will import.

If you're just passing around structured data, then you're only using Object as a map, and you'll be better off using a documented POJO, as that will make serialization completely painless, saving you time when you want to transfer that data over the wire (which will inevitably happen at some point).

body:
If you have shared objects with shared _behavior_, consider putting them in their own class and packaging the class as a module that all dependents will import.

If you're just passing around _structured data_, then you're only using `Object` as a map, and you'll be better off using a documented POJO, as that will make serialization completely painless, saving you time when you want to transfer that data over the wire (which will inevitably happen at some point).
